TextView.android:text: The Zoning Certification is issued to individuals needing this document for titling purposes or zoning clearance for securing building permit.
1. Requirements for Securing Zoning Certificate within CADT
a. Proof of Ownership over the Land to be used (1 copy each)
i. Contract of Usufruct for CADT Area
ii. Certificate of Land Occupancy (COLO)/Certificate of Land Allocation (COLA)
iii. FEMMATRICS Certification recognizing area occupied/allotted (signed by the chairman)
c. Affidavit of No Objection (w/in 250m radius)
d. Barangay Resolution Interposing No Objection
e. DPWH RROW Clearance (Subject to MPDO & MEO verification)
f. Notarized Authorization of persons allowed to transact/follow-up the certificate
2. Requirements for Securing Zoning Certificate within A&D
a. Proof of Ownership over the Land to be used (1 copy each)
i. Certificate of Title registered in the name of the applicant

ii. Certified true copy of Tax Declaration in the absence of Certificate of Title. In case the property is not registered in the name of the applicant, submit a photocopy of the owner’s certificate of title or in the absence of title, the tax declaration and any of the following:
iii. Deed of Sale or Contract of Lease
iv. Authorization to use the land
c. Affidavit of No Objection (w/in 250m radius)
d. Barangay Resolution Interposing No Objection
e. DPWH RROW Clearance (Subject to MPDO & MEO verification)
f. Notarized Authorization of persons allowed to transact/follow-up the certificate
1. Submit all the requirements to Mun. Planning & Development Office
2. Go to Municipal Treasurer Office to pay the Zoning Certification Fee
2.1. Release of receipt for Zoning Certification
3. Return to MPDO to present the receipt
3.1. Validate the receipt and record the OR Number
5. Accomplish the Client Satisfaction Survey (CSS) and drop it in the Feedback Box
5.1. Request the client to accomplish the Client Satisfaction Survey (CSS)
